Going both ways...
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher Card & Adventure Video Games: Monster Rancher Battlecard Episode II Archive (PSOne): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): Going both ways...
By torey_luvullo on Tuesday, August 29, 2000 - 04:44 am:

i am now gaining confidence [at easy level] my second year into the game. at the last phoenix cup, i won all my matches. i beat stolatos and rascal. it looks to be a matter of time until i get the remaining monsters i need, go back in 1003 and get cue her first win, or get pabs to win out.

i worry about it lasting, however. i see advanced players' recipes, and what i notice is that the decks are designed to either steamroll an opponent with attacks, or wait out an opponent with withering and defense.

my current troisamies team/deck/recipe is tailored to the fact that i dont know all the opponents yet. it tends toward the defensive side, but also features some heavy hitting worm and golem attacks if i see that is what is needed. it has both lock tight and nice fight, again, as needed. some battles, i dont even do damage to the other team; some battles, i knock them out.

in your experience, will there come a point where i won't be able to have things both ways? where the decks will get stronger, and i will have to commit sooner to defeat stronger play by my opponents? or do you think a well-refined "goes both ways" strategy is one that can be consistently successful against the game players?

if you think it would help for me to post my current recipe, i would be glad to do so.

By Tony on Tuesday, August 29, 2000 - 05:43 am:

I think you can go both ways, although I've gone strictly with a knockout power team. FJ seems to have a deck (Plant Fire) that is used strictly to wither opponents down and make them run out of cards, and has been successful with it. I tried a team similar to it before with moderate success, and now that I have a recipe from him and Eagle (Romantic Flair), I am willing to venture into that realm of battle strategy again.

As far as the Championship Cup, and getting Phoenix, I am in 1006 now, and I got the Phoenix card in 1003 after getting the rest of the monster cards in the plate. Every battle since then, Cue always wins her first match, and then I win. After the fight, Pabs says some crap about me being such a great champion...blah blah blah. I got one thing to say to Pabs: You gotta start pulling your load old man! Me and Cue can't do it all! In fact, I'm so sick of you trying to play the role of Vince Lombardi, that I might just sit out the next Championship Cup and you can get somebody else to join your fold, cause I can tear you a new one!! Whoops..sorry! I didn't mean to get off on a rant there!

By torey luvullo on Tuesday, August 29, 2000 - 09:54 am:

hehehe. i love the way they make pabs such a pathetic blowhard. it's especially funny, given his big speech about trainers not getting lazy after raising a championship monster, blah blah blah legends cup blah blah blah. its obvious that he accomplished exactly one thing in his career - he raised most - and has been resting on his laurels ever since.

By Farmer Jimbo on Tuesday, August 29, 2000 - 12:14 pm:

First of all Torey, are you asking if it's ok to "go both ways?" ;)

Seriously though, the team that won most of my battles was named "Hard Balance." It was a Durahan, Plant, Mocchi team that, as the name implied, tried to achieve a balance between attack and defense. The Durahan delivered raw power, the plant could wither and block, and the mocchi could peck away and dodge. Obviously it's easier to construct a team with only one strategy in mind, but a balanced team can be much more satisfying to play with.

I've always wanted to build a deck that takes Nelson's strategy to the next level, and Plant Fire is it. I'm confident though that if I get bored with Plant Fire, I can always rebuild a balance team and be very successful with it.

By Tony on Tuesday, August 29, 2000 - 12:42 pm:

Yep...problem with the decks like Plant Fire is that it can get BORING!! Just taking 1 GUTS here and there can make it drag on forever.

By Farmer Jimbo on Tuesday, August 29, 2000 - 12:51 pm:

I'm not arguing that some people will find Plant Fire too boring to use, but... Toxic Nectar takes away three guts, Toxic pollen withers five guts, and I've wiped out as much as twenty guts with one Fainted card. I personally find it hilarious when someone like Vijadela says: "Darn it! You run around like a chicken! You suck!" Just thinking about it makes me grin.

By Lisa Shock on Tuesday, August 29, 2000 - 03:40 pm:

By torey_luvullo on Tuesday, August 29, 2000 - 04:23 pm:

torey is on easy. remember, the game has been out almost a month now. a lot of people have been playing more than me. i am still encountering opponents who are not using their best decks against me.

and, to be sure, your main point is also well-taken - it is not as challenging or deep as mr2.

By Kurasu Soratobu on Tuesday, August 29, 2000 - 06:13 pm:

For decks, I may not have played as much as the SO has, but my 'Weenie Poke' deck seems to be very successful, thus far undefeated. Of course, this isn't saying much, when we're talking about the early fighters. ;) It's your average, basic low-guts-low-damage-with-Hot-Battle deck. Not too original, but very successful, thus far.

Thomas has other decks that are more for fun than strategy, but they actually have a pretty high win ratio, so you don't need to have the high thump or the 'annoyance value' decks. I think it's a matter of choice.

By torey_luvullo on Saturday, September 2, 2000 - 05:41 pm:

time for a weekend update.

it is november 1002. 3 months to go until the 1003 phoenix cup - the event the flying pigs, and card trainer torey luvullo, with the troisamies team/deck, have been waiting for. 2 monsters left to get now in the 2 month period - gali and dragon. i have met all the people and been invited to all the places. i especially like the statue in nelson's house - it looks like he hired the same designer who designed the beverly hillbillies' mansion.

my deck is tending toward defense, while keeping open the possibillity of the big knockout. i have added another dodge, and golem throw away, and eliminated two little pixie attacks. i win on ties about 3/4 of the time now. i'm glad i kept the firepower, tho, against chaille, for example.

looks like i will play enough to post one more report before labor day...

By torey luvullo on Saturday, September 2, 2000 - 10:46 pm:

well, with a tip of the cap to suezo183, who chatted with me quite a while tonight, i fought many battles - and now have all the monsters but phoenix. the flying pigs are very confident that now is the time to achieve our goal, and win that phoenix card!
